page.title: 03VILLAGES NEAR PETERSFIELD 1
page.content: {Sheet}is a village on the eastern edge of Petersfield. It is older than the town of Petersfield. There is a fine horse chestnut tree on the village green which was planted for Queen Victoria's Diamond Jubilee in l887. The narrow Village Street was once the main London to Portsmouth road, until the A3 road was made in the l8th Century. Mill Lane has quite a lot of old attractive cottages near the river Rother and two old water mills. A timber-framed house opposite dates from about l600. The Priest-in-charge of St. Mary's Church holds a picnic each year for the children and adults who go to the church. There is a puppet show and pony rides and the game Treasure Hunt. It is very exciting and good fun. St. Mary's is a daughter church of St. Peter's.
